articles.title: U Can Study Blonde: Elle Woods Goes Gaucho for Fashion Merchandising Ph.D.
articles.description: After completing a campus visit and tour yesterday, Harvard Law graduate and political activist Elle Woods made her decision to enroll at UC Santa Barbara official by submitting her statement of inten...
articles.content:
Jenny De La Cuadra / Daily Nexus

After completing a campus visit and tour yesterday, Harvard Law graduate and political activist Elle Woods made her decision to enroll at UC Santa Barbara official by submitting her statement of intent to register. With an already impressive resume and educational background, Woods stated that pursuing her next degree will be another ‚Äútotally great‚Äù endeavor.

‚ÄúEver since I started working in Washington, I‚Äôve been thinking about my next career move,‚Äù said Woods as she posed in front of the art department‚Äôs mural for a photo. ‚ÄúEducation has always been a top priority for me, and UCSB‚Äôs stellar reputation really appealed to me.‚Äù

Woods will be the first student to enroll in the newly formed Department of Fashion Merchandising in the College of Letters and Science, representing another groundbreaking innovation for UCSB‚Äôs educational offerings.

View this post on Instagram

"In diversity there is beauty and there is strength." üåà #MayaAngelou üì∏: @avaphillippe

A post shared by Reese Witherspoon (@reesewitherspoon) on Feb 1, 2017 at 10:15am PST

The CULA alum spoke about how much she missed California during her time on the east coast, but wanted a change of scenery when she finally returned. ‚ÄúI kept hearing about all the things Santa Barbara is known for: the beach, the parties, its six Nobel Laureates and its competitive national ranking as a top public university. I knew for sure it would be the perfect fit when I saw its diverse blonde population!‚Äù

Woods says she has big plans for the upcoming school year, some of which include leading research projects based on her thesis examining the effects of half-loop stitching on low viscosity rayon and establishing the first UCSB chapter of the Delta Nu sorority.

¬†

Jasmine Vaughn is a third-year communication major who‚Äôs graduating early because what, like it‚Äôs hard?

articles.title: Marijuana Legalization Used as Coping Mechanism for Californians Under Trump Presidency
articles.description: ISLA VISTA, CA - Amidst the dark clouds surrounding election night, a cloud of a different type began to rise above the nerve-wracked streets of I.V.
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

ISLA VISTA, CA ‚Äì Amidst the dark clouds surrounding election night, a cloud of a different type began to rise above the nerve-wracked streets of I.V.

As news spread about the newly legalized use of recreational marijuana, citizens all over California set down their constantly refreshing screens of election results and picked up their paraphernalia to toke up some devil‚Äôs lettuce.

‚ÄúI mean, at least now I have a way to deal with my impending doom,‚Äù Lea Shelly, first-year and owner of a medical marijuana for chronic arthritis, said. ‚ÄúBefore this, I was just drinking to calm my anxiety, but this is much more efficient.‚Äù

Sales of Mary Jane are already skyrocketing within hours of the news, and dealers are having a tough time keeping up with supply. However, it doesn‚Äôt seem like they‚Äôre complaining.

‚ÄúAfter that law passed, I knew my student loans wouldn‚Äôt be a problem anymore,‚Äù Steve McPlug said in between counting mad stacks of bills.

One unexpected side effect of the law may be its environmental impact. NASA reports an increasingly large fog spreading over California. Originating in the greater Isla Vista area, the smoke immediately began to spread in all directions, growing denser and more potent. One researcher even described the mysterious fog as ‚Äúdank.‚Äù Other researchers worry about the lasting effects of this fog and expressed that they don‚Äôt believe it will dissipate any time soon.

‚ÄúThe data says that the smoke cloud is enough to affect UV ray dissipation in the area. Normally I‚Äôd be concerned, but if you can‚Äôt beat them, join ‚Äòem,‚Äù Richard Stevenson, Ph.D. in environmental studies, said before pulling the biggest bong rip this reporter has ever witnessed.

Jasmine Vaughn is a third-year communication major who injects 420 marijuanas every 69 minutes. Ariana Marmolejo is a second-year theater major who is a huge devil‚Äôs lettuce aficionado.

articles.title: The Essential Isla Vista Fashion Guide
articles.description: Most seasoned Gauchos have learned these lessons the hard way, but even the most experienced partiers can learn from these useful tips for getting ready before your next rager.
articles.content:
¬†

Kailey Flora / Daily Nexus

Isla Vista is unique in so many beautiful ways, but it‚Äôs particularly noticeable in nightlife fashion choices. What you wear to go out anywhere else is not what you want to wear to go out to I.V. Most seasoned Gauchos have learned these lessons the hard way, but even the most experienced partiers¬†can learn from these useful tips for getting ready before your next rager. (Note: this advice is generally aimed at girls, but fashion knows no gender.)

Your ‚ÄúI.V. Shoes‚Äù

We‚Äôll start with the essentials, from the bottom up. Your designated drinking shoes need to be durable, comfortable and devoid of personal value. That one pair of Converse in the back of your closet need to be the ones you reserve for your weekend shenanigans. When the weekend ends, try not to wear them to class on Monday, lest you bring the smell of spilt beer and regret with you.

Get your Insta shot in early

The only time you‚Äôre going to look good enough for social media is while you‚Äôre still sober (unless drunk candids are your thing, then don‚Äôt worry about it). Either document your #ootn before your first drink or risk only getting a bunch of pictures as blurry as your memories will be.

Basic =/= Bad

I.V. uniform: your choice of shorts or leggings, paired with a crop top or tank. It‚Äôs simple, always looks cute, but still stays comfortable. Depending on how cold out it is, you may or may not opt to cover your legs. And before you can cry ‚Äú#basic,‚Äù remember that going back to the basics isn‚Äôt inherently a bad thing.

No rompers

This rule applies to anything that inhibits your peeing ability: onesies, bodysuits, dressy belts, etc. Whether you‚Äôre doing your business crowded into a frat bathroom with your friends or squatting in the bushes: you don‚Äôt want to be topless when this happens.

Leave precious outfits at home

If you just got the cutest new top, do you really want to break it in on DP? You might be tempted to show it off, but try to remember what you looked like after the last time you went raging, and imaging that new top or skirt looking as bad as you did. Keep this in mind when choosing accessories as well.

Invest in that primer/sealer/setting spray

Your best bet for keeping anything you put on your face there for the duration of the party is pre-makeup and post-makeup protection. Anything you can do to help the staying power of that eyeliner or lipstick is an important step to take, or else accept the fact that beauty is fleeting. Convince yourself that the natural/smudged look is what you were going for in the first place.

Don‚Äôt forget hair ties

Knowing how quickly any dance floor can become a sweaty and sticky situation, girls with long hair should come prepared. Plus, during your inevitable puke-and-rally, you can be a strong independent woman who doesn‚Äôt need anyone to hold her hair back! Feminism equals a puke-free ponytail. Beyonc√© would be proud.

¬†

Jasmine Vaughn is a third-year communication major who never leaves the house without a hair tie or five.

Print

articles.title: Unsure Student Desperately Searches for Confirmation They‚Äôre in Correct Classroom
articles.description: "If someone in front of me could pull up their G.O.L.D. or write the class title on the top of their page, I would feel a lot better right now."
articles.content:
After checking his schedule once before leaving home, once after parking his bike and three times on the walk to South Hall 1738, Aaron Wright still felt like he was in the wrong place upon walking into the overfilled lecture hall. Taking his first steps through the threshold, he immediately wished he could go back outside and double-check the number on the door one more time.

‚ÄúThere was no turning back at that point, so I took a seat and committed,‚Äù Wright said about the harrowing experience.

Due to crippling social anxiety, asking someone sitting nearby about what class he was in was utterly out of the question, so Wright took to other means of finding out.

‚ÄúIf someone in front of me could pull up their G.O.L.D. or write the class title on the top of their page, I would feel a lot better right now.‚Äù

After minutes of desperate scanning of the rows in front of him, Wright thought his salvation had finally come after the professor took his sweet time loading his introductory PowerPoint. However, his heart sank when the first slide came up and simply read ‚ÄúSeptember 26: Introduction‚Äù on a white background.

‚ÄúAt this point, I‚Äôm too strung out to get up and leave without definitely embarrassing myself on the way out, so I guess I‚Äôll just put my name on the sign-in sheet and hope for the best.‚Äù

Wright was last seen getting lost on the way to his next section.

¬†

Jasmine Vaughn is a third-year communication major who sits in the back of the classroom so she can read people‚Äôs G.O.L.D. calendars.

Print

articles.title: Mattress Theft On the Rise as The Chainsmokers Glorify Being an Asshole to Your Roommate
articles.description: One victim of theft reported "the worst part is she took the sheets, too, and I bet she doesn't even keep them pulled over the corners."
articles.content:
courtesy of reddit.com

Local crime rates are up after an electronic dance song inspired a string of very specific thefts across the county. Reports of stolen mattresses are up 1,738 percent in the past month, and authorities say these copycat crimes are directly correlated to radio plays of ‚ÄúCloser‚Äù by The Chainsmokers.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve seen a lot in my 50 years on the force, but I‚Äôve never seen theft with such pathetic motive,‚Äù said IVFP Lieutenant Benjamin Clawhauser. ‚ÄúKids these days just don‚Äôt steal like they used to.‚Äù

The public is warned to be on the lookout for suspicious characters with shoulder tattoos in Range Rovers.

Ivy Abrams, a recently mattressless third year, reports noticing strange behavior from her roommate prior to the event of the crime.

‚ÄúI mean, yeah, she listened to that song a lot, but so does everyone else. I didn‚Äôt really think much of it because I was always trying to block it out with my headphones,‚Äù Abrams said.

When asked if she and her roommate were close before said roommate left town with Abrams‚Äô mattress in tow, Abrams said ‚Äúshe was usually too busy shopping for bralettes and complaining about the cost of EDC for us to talk much.‚Äù

A class action lawsuit led by mattressless roommates is gaining momentum against the band, with Halsey now being investigated as an accomplice to the crimes committed by The Chainsmokers. Charges against them include cruel and unusual lyrics, negligent musical behavior and general assholery.

The public is warned to be on the lookout for suspicious characters with shoulder tattoos in Range Rovers.

‚ÄúThe worst part is¬†she took the sheets, too, and I bet she doesn‚Äôt even keep them pulled over the corners,‚Äù Abrams said.

¬†

Jasmine Vaughn is a third-year communication major who ain‚Äôt ever getting older.

Print

articles.title: Sophomore Slump Now Entering 7th Quarter
articles.description: As fall 2016 approaches, incoming seniors are left looking at their life and the choices that have led them here.
articles.content:
¬†

Oliver Zuniga / Daily Nexus

Rising fourth-year communication major Edward Young has been looking forward to his senior year since starting at UCSB, promising four-day weekends and a beautiful view from oceanside Del Playa Drive. However, going into Fall Quarter, prospects are looking gloomy as summer winds down.

‚ÄúLooking back, I had a pretty rough second year, but survived with a 2.2 GPA at the end of it. This year was the year I was gonna pick it back up, but it was still ‚Ä¶ pretty rough,‚Äù Young said. ‚ÄúMade it to the end of spring with a 2.3, though.‚Äù

Young is now hoping that this year will, in fact, be the year things come around for him.

After his first year, Young said he felt confident in his adjustment to college living and took advantage of his well-padded GE GPA for the next few quarters.

‚ÄúWhen my grades started slipping, I just figured it was because I was getting used to upper division classes and a tougher workload. I never thought the constant partying, blackout drinking and multiple absences from lecture would have anything to do with it,‚Äù he said.

As he heads into his seventh quarter of university, Young has high expectations despite his 9 p.m. lab on Friday evenings and his apartment on the 68 block of Fortuna Road.

Although he admits he regrets not buying any textbooks that year, he looks back upon his most recent school year more fondly. Young‚Äôs junior year reenergized him with a desire to work hard and be productive.

‚ÄúThis past year, I planned a study schedule, reserved a room at the library once a week, attended all my scheduled lectures and even got a job,‚Äù Young said.

This strategy worked and motivated Edward to succeed in school until he started using the library study room to nap in and spent every lecture on his laptop shopping online. He also admitted he quit his job due to his ‚Äúirreconcilable professional differences‚Äù with doing the dishes at DLG.

As he heads into his seventh quarter of university, Young has high expectations despite his 9 p.m. lab on Friday evenings and his apartment on the 68 block of Fortuna Road. ¬†

‚ÄúMy biggest goal this year is to get into English 10, and I know if I really give it my all, I can probably crash the course. Wish me luck, though.‚Äù

¬†

Jasmine Vaughn is a communication major who just finished her sophomore year and never draws from her own life experiences when writing satire articles.

Print

articles.title: President Trump Implements Project to ‚ÄòMake Isla Vista Great Again‚Äô
articles.description: Local residents were graced with the presence of President Trump when he stopped as part of his multi-step program, ‚ÄúMake Isla Vista Great Again.‚Äù
articles.content:
Tarush Mohanti / Daily Nexus

ISLA VISTA ‚Äî Local residents were graced with the presence of Overlord President Trump on April 20, 2017 during one of the stops along his tour of the Western District. The visit is part of the surveying process, step one of his latest multi-step citizen improvement program, ‚ÄúMake Isla Vista Great Again.‚Äù

The Donald was reportedly quite pleased with the town‚Äôs potential and is already starting early action in the program. One important improvement being implemented is a wall along El Colegio Rd., surrounding the town to keep out out-of-towners.

‚ÄúWhen other towns send their OOTs, they‚Äôre not sending the best. They‚Äôre not sending your best friend from high school; they‚Äôre sending people that have lots of problems, and they‚Äôre bringing those problems with them. They‚Äôre bringing riots. They‚Äòre bringing alcohol, and they‚Äôre not sharing it. They‚Äôre party crashers. And some, I assume, are good people,‚Äù Trump said.

Trump‚Äôs rebranding program also involves renaming Isla Vista‚Äôs ‚Äúoverly ethnic-sounding‚Äù streets. The road formerly known as Del Playa Drive will now be referred to as ‚ÄúThe Beach Drive,‚Äù Sabado Tarde Road is now called ‚ÄúSaturday Afternoon Road,‚Äù and residents of El Greco Road now live on ‚ÄúIvanka Road.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou know, I‚Äôve always loved the Del Playa. It‚Äôs a beautiful place, beautiful. But why not just call it what it is: ‚ÄòThe Beach.‚Äô‚Äù That‚Äôs a very good name for a street; very classy, very good,‚Äù said Trump.

The town is honored that His Trumpiness¬†found time in his extremely busy schedule for the visit. Other projects going into effect in the future include the elimination of excessive, ‚Äúun-American‚Äù food vendors in Isla Vista. Many unpopular restauranteurs like those at Freebirds and Naan Stop will be deported to make room for the up-and-coming fine dining establishments Trump Sandwiches and Trump Burgers. Both restaurants promise to offer the citizens of Isla Vista ‚Äúbeautiful food at a huge, absolutely massive, quantity.‚Äù

Jasmine Vaughn is a second-year communication major who thinks Donald Trump is on an episode of ‚ÄúPunk‚Äôd‚Äù that‚Äôs been running for too long.

Print

articles.title: 5 Useful Apps for the Average UCSB Student
articles.description: Although technology has progressed rapidly over the past decade, the fact that I still have to get out of bed for my morning caffeine is proof enough that it has not progressed enough. For most of lif...
articles.content:
Although technology has progressed rapidly over the past decade, the fact that I still have to get out of bed for my morning caffeine is proof enough that it has not progressed enough. For most of life‚Äôs little inconveniences, humankind has come up with genius solutions like blankets with sleeves or hot-dog-cutting robots, but the genius of the app market is still largely untapped. Sure, I can use my phone to pay a stranger with a car to come pick me up, but can it locate the nearest available dog for petting? I, for one, will not rest until these crucial applications are available to all who need them.

1.) Fiesta Tiempo/Party Time

via buzzfeed.com

Dilemma: You‚Äôre three shots in, but it‚Äôs only 8 p.m. and the party is supposed to start at 9. How many more shots will it take to make sure you aren‚Äôt sober by the time you get there?

Solution: Fiesta Tiempo calculates all the real life math you‚Äôll ever need, and acts as the most important alarm clock you could ever use. By comparing your alcohol intake to your height, weight and age, it can tell you the exact amount you should intake for the prime level of pregaming. As the pre-party progresses, it will also let you know the best time to leave, considering time, distance and amount of alcohol left at the party. Later on in the evening, it will also notify you of optimal party leaving times, calculating traffic, pedestrians and Uber availability.

2.) Arbor Alarms

via giphy.com

Dilemma: You‚Äôre just trying to get to your next class in peace when, in the span of 10 seconds, you‚Äôre assaulted by a recruiting frat bro, a political surveyor and a poster of a fetus. How will you make it through this socio-political activism nightmare?

Solution: Arbor Alarms is constantly updated with the names and locations of every org tabling between the library and Girvetz. Simplify your morning walk by using its helpful suggested shortcuts, or get notifications for giveaways and free promotions you actually care about. With Arbor Alarms, you‚Äôll never miss another free slice of pizza or be assaulted by a religious fundamentalist ever again.

3.) Library Looker

via hilariousgifs.com

Dilemma: It‚Äôs week 10, and some have taken to setting up camping gear in the library. Anyone who leaves their seat vacant for more than 30 seconds is eliminated Hunger Games style and immediately replaced by another contestant. How are you ever going to find the textbook you‚Äôve been ignoring for nine weeks in this shit show?

Solution: All seats, outlets, tables and couches in the Davidson Library have been tagged with Library Looker‚Äôs patented sensors, triggered after 10 seconds of vacancy. Get notified for the prime time to swoop on a spot as its former owner heads home or even just takes a bathroom break. Paired with its compatible motion-sensing alarm seat cushion, you‚Äôll have your dibs protected once you snag that last chair on the eighth floor.

4.) IVGPS [or I.V. GPS]

via gurl.com

Dilemma: Your snapchat feed is full of sunset photos, cute dogs, free ice cream and pictures of your friends having way more fun than you. Your story has one picture of you, eating soup alone on a bench. How do you keep missing out on all the cool shit your friends are doing?

Solution: IVGPS is your all in one guide to every cool thing that happens in the 1.86 square miles that we call Isla Vista. Users can post alerts for any event, from parties, to dog sightings, to free food alerts. Get notifications for when an event is within a two-block radius, or set your distance even further to see what 68 block has to offer. Daily notifications for optimum sunset snapchat time is a popular, but optional setting.

5.) Frenemy Finder

via curvesalamode.com

Dilemma: Your roommate is never home when you need them, but always there when you don‚Äôt. For three lectures in a row, you‚Äôve ended up sitting next to an asshole with no concept of elbow room. You keep missing your friends at the dining commons by five minutes. How you do locate the people you like and get away from the scumbags you seem to attract?

Solution: Frenemy Finder is more than just your average friend GPS locator. Its built-in morality judgement feature uses sophisticated dating website software to figure out how likely you are to hate or like a person. The finder will warn you as you approach someone with a low compatibility rating or high fuckboi score, but will guide you in the direction of your friends, acquaintances and hot singles in your area.

Print

articles.title: Josh Inga Uncovered: The Free & For Sale Legend
articles.description: Even if you‚Äôve only recently joined the UCSB Free & For Sale Facebook group, you‚Äôve likely already come across some interesting wares. Although the page promises ‚Äúdirty couches, alcohol, and...
articles.content:
Courtesy of Josh Inga

Even if you‚Äôve only recently joined the UCSB Free & For Sale Facebook group, you‚Äôve likely already come across some interesting wares. Although the page promises ‚Äúdirty couches, alcohol, and worn panties,‚Äù one man offers items for a more particular buyer. If your shopping desires aren‚Äôt fulfilled by the average used sweatshirt or IKEA shelf, look no further than Josh Inga for your quirky purchase needs. If his name doesn‚Äôt ring a bell, you may recognize him as one of F&FS‚Äôs most popular vendors with products ranging from novelty neon signs to nautical memorabilia. If you‚Äôve ever wondered, ‚ÄúHow can I get my hands on a skateboard deck with, not one, but two sets of authentic antlers mounted on it?‚Äù then look no further, because Mr. Inga has got you covered.

Courtesy of Josh Inga

Surprisingly, the 20-year-old earth science major says he doesn‚Äôt have any current career plans of going into sales, but says it definitely ‚Äúwould be a good backup plan.‚Äù ¬†Whether or not his business is the next great entrepreneurial enterprise, his current goal is largely just to ‚Äúsupply I.V. with some interesting and unique items for cheap.‚Äù

Like many of F&FS‚Äôs patrons, I was dying to find out where Inga‚Äôs incredible selection of goods comes from, but the man‚Äôs privacy must be respected.

‚ÄúI do not want to reveal where I find the stuff I sell, but it comes from multiple sources. I guess you could say I collect unique goods, but I sell most of the stuff I have. Thrift stores are more expensive than you would think, and I price my items below what you would find at a thrift store or on eBay.‚Äù

Wherever they come from, Josh‚Äôs sales are a methodical process. With over 1,000 posts under his belt at this point, he‚Äôs got the process down to a science from selection to advertisement.

‚ÄúI post things that either are functional [or] I know sell fairly easy such as a skateboard or lava lamp, then any really unusual items such as a taxidermy deer horns or vintage oil paintings,‚Äù Inga said.

If you haven‚Äôt seen his posts yet, you aren‚Äôt looking hard enough, because with ‚Äúup to five ads a day‚Äù Inga is broadcasting at maximum levels. For those looking to expand their own customer reach, here‚Äôs a tip from the master himself: He posts most often on weekday afternoons ‚Äúbecause that‚Äôs when things sell the best.‚Äù

These posts aren‚Äôt anything to sneeze at either. While they won‚Äôt replace Josh‚Äôs job as a research diver for a on-campus lab, he says it‚Äôs a nice way to make some extra dough.

‚ÄúMy posts are profitable depending on the item. Some items just don‚Äôt sell and others turn into bidding wars and go for way more than I was expecting.‚Äù

Even if some sales don‚Äôt land in the end, at least popularity and uniqueness is on his side.

‚ÄúOne of my favorite things I ever posted was a pig launcher. It got over 400 likes and sold for $20.‚Äù

Courtesy of Josh Inga

Due to the unpredictable nature of his products, it‚Äôs hard to tell what‚Äôs coming up in the future, but the new quarter brings in new deals.

‚ÄúI do have a lot of new upcoming sales, but I don‚Äôt really have a set product, so what I post varies significantly. I get a lot of new stuff at the beginning of each quarter so you can always expect something you have never seen before for a great deal then.‚Äù

Courtesy of Josh Inga

Of course, Josh is a truly appreciative seller and would like to thank all of his customers for their business. If you‚Äôre interested in any of his sales, he welcomes potential customers to contact him with any questions, and as any good F&FS vendor does, Josh lives by the golden ‚ÄúOBO‚Äù (or best offer) rule.

‚ÄúIf you have something cool that you want to sell or trade, contact me. You can search my name in F&FS or type I.V./UCSB into Craigslist to see a full list of what I have available. If you are interested in a few items, I will bundle them for a better price, and most of my posts are OBO so don‚Äôt be afraid to make me an offer.‚Äù

Courtesy of Josh Inga

And, for the record, his ruler is not up for grabs.

Print

articles.title: Hoverboard Craze: Dangerous or Sexy?
articles.description: Three are injured and two are in emergency care after a crash on the sidewalk in front of the Arbor yesterday morning. Reports say the accident was caused when a hoverboarder lost control of his vehic...
articles.content:
via youtube.com

Three are injured and two are in emergency care after a crash on the sidewalk in front of the Arbor yesterday morning. Reports say the accident was caused when a hoverboarder lost control of his vehicle while driving through a puddle and swerved into a cluster of female onlookers too distracted to move.

‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt raining that day, but I sure was wet,‚Äù said one witness about the accident.

All victims of the crash have good health reports, but this issue is now an epidemic, says Owen Winston, the hoverboarder in the incident.

‚ÄúThis is the third accident I‚Äôve been in this year and they‚Äôve only been getting worse. Safety precautions definitely need to be enacted; this is an important upcoming issue.‚Äù

When asked what issue he was referring to, he corrected himself.

‚ÄúOh, not the hoverboards, they‚Äôre totally safe. No, I was talking about the girls around me, they get so wet that I hydroplane and it‚Äôs become a serious problem.‚Äù

Many critics of the new mode of transportation have pointed out other major flaws, including no restrictions yet placed on hoverboards, no safety gear requirements and no emergency brake system.

When asked about these criticisms, Winston responded, ‚ÄúA hoverboard doesn‚Äôt have brakes because swag doesn‚Äôt stop.‚Äù

Beyond the recurring accidents he experiences, Winston also emphasized the benefits of hoverboarding as a commute.

‚ÄúMy swegway saves me so much time, I can get an energy drink before showing up 10 minutes late to class. Sometimes I get there even earlier so I can grab that aisle seat at the end of an empty row near the front; it‚Äôs got plenty of storage space for all my stuff on the floor.‚Äù

Convenience and time saved make it worth the risks of water hazards or spontaneous combustion, he says.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs made texting on the way to class so much easier. I used to focus on moving one leg after the other but now 100% of my attention can be devoted to my screen alone.‚Äù

Winston continues to tout the benefits outweigh any cost, physical or monetary.

‚ÄúYeah, I dropped half my rent on this thing, but the ladies are worth it. Girls love me because I always pay for guac. Yeah, I know it‚Äôs extra. So what? I‚Äôll tell you what‚Äôs extra: I am.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy condom expenses are starting to really make a dent in my budget, though. You know, because of the incredible amounts of protected sex I‚Äôm having thanks to my new hoverboard.‚Äù

Print

articles.title: DIY Ugly Christmas Sweater Guide
articles.description: A step-by-step guide to uglifying a perfectly good sweater, just in time for the holiday season! Hopefully this guide inspires the mediocre DIY artists of our generation, as well as the people who are...
articles.content:
A step-by-step guide to uglifying a perfectly good sweater, just in time for the holiday season! Hopefully this guide inspires the mediocre DIY artists of our generation, as well as the people who are stuck at home and happen to be incredibly bored.

Step 1: Purchase a sweater. It can be a fuzzy, knit one, a basic sweatshirt or one from a club or band you used to care about. Lay the sweater out and examine your options.

Jasmine Vaughn // Daily Nexus

Step 2: Start brainstorming ideas. Try to choose a decorative medium that represents you as a person. For this example I will be using pasta and glitter, but don‚Äôt feel restricted to those two items. You do you, Booboo.

Jasmine Vaughn / Daily Nexus

Step 3: Lay out a basic pattern for your sweater design. This is where you get to play around with shapes and designs before making a commitment, which is terrifying because commitment is scary because we are millennials. #relatable.

Jasmine Vaughn / Daily Nexus

Step 4: Glue all your shit down. Alfredo sauce¬†can be used as a possible glue substitute.¬†

Jasmine Vaughn / Daily Nexus

Step 5: Take a moment to pour yourself a glass of something because you earned it. I chose pomegranate juice because I‚Äôm still at the tender young age of 19 and I‚Äôm staying with my parents for the holidays.¬†

Jasmine Vaughn / Daily Nexus

Step 6: Test out your sweater by holding it up against yourself in the mirror like a suburban mom at Target. Inspect your work. If more glitter is needed, now is the time to add it.

Jasmine Vaughn / Daily Nexus

Step 7: Once a sufficient amount of glitter has been affixed to your sweater, put it on to gain a feel for it.

Step 8: When every inch of fabric has been thoroughly adorned with decoration, get out and show that baby off to the world. The best time to wear an ugly sweater is all the time.

Merry Carbmas!

Print

articles.title: Liberal Arts Student Puts Aside Social Justice to Enjoy Family Dinner
articles.description: In recent years, the young people of the millennial generation have grown out of the warmth and comfort of their childhood holiday experiences, transitioning into the cold, harsh reality of adulthood....
articles.content:
via dailymail.co.uk

In recent years, the young people of the millennial generation have grown out of the warmth and comfort of their childhood holiday experiences, transitioning into the cold, harsh reality of adulthood. Balancing the desire to remain knowledgeable on current social issues while still enjoying family discussions at dinner brings up an internal conflict that plagues our generation. This year, a movement has been created to stop the arguing. Instead, bottle up your beliefs for a day in order to enjoy the holidays as you did when you were young. This movement, which is easier said than done, brought students together as they steeled themselves in preparation for this week‚Äôs Thanksgiving festivities.

‚ÄúYou would think it gets easier each year ‚Äî that you would build up a thick skin against this stuff,‚Äù Jessica Reyes, a third-year feminist studies major, said. ‚ÄúBut no ‚Äî somehow Aunt Helen‚Äôs speech about Obamacare is just as hard to listen to as it was in 2009. If I hear her mention how luscious Trump‚Äôs golden locks are or how ‚Äòbrilliant‚Äô his immigration plans sound one more time, I‚Äôm going to lose it.‚Äù

Jessica is a veteran of these battles ‚Äî a seasoned professional at surviving her family‚Äôs remarks around the dinner table. ‚ÄúThings were easier when I was young and didn‚Äôt know much, but it‚Äôs been a downhill spiral ever since my first Twitter account. The college years ‚Äî or as Aunt Helen calls them, my ‚Äòhippie, liberal, good for nothin‚Äô years‚Äô ‚Äî were when things really started to heat up. However, that‚Äôs when I stopped arguing and started drinking.‚Äù

As the leader of the organization SABR, or Students Against Bigoted Relatives, Reyes has collaborated with other activist and multicultural groups on campus to prepare students with some techniques in order to get through the holiday season. Weekly meetings leading up to the holiday breaks focused on sharing advice and helpful tips for getting through the holidays without any mental breakdowns. One tip shared by Reyes includes switching out your relative‚Äôs hard apple cider for something a bit weaker, such as some tequila and a Xanax or three.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been going to trainings since October, when they were teaching us how to deal with our especially homophobic relatives,‚Äù said Rick Jackson, a first-year Black studies major. ‚ÄúI used a lot of these techniques at Thanksgiving yesterday, starting with the ‚Äòsmile and wave‚Äô approach when greeting problematic relatives, and eventually employing the ‚Äòreassure and relax‚Äô method, when trying to make grandpa realize that just because a man has nice eyebrows does not mean he enjoys intercourse with men.‚Äù

Another UCSB student, second-year Christina Phan, testifies to the success that SABR offers. ‚ÄúMy brother and I have loved Christmas since we were young, but after taking our first ethnicity requirement classes this quarter, we realized all we wanted from Santa this year was less racist relatives. Thanks to SABR, I‚Äôve learned to condition my grandma to realize that Enrique, my current boyfriend, is not, in fact, our gardener.‚Äù

The SABR club will be offering more training sessions during dead and finals week for those who are interested.

‚ÄúWe highly recommend using the drinking game we invented ‚Äî if you‚Äôre of legal age of course,‚Äù Phan said. ‚ÄúYou take a sip of your wine when an edgy topic is brought up, finish your glass if anything about the presidential race is mentioned, open a new bottle if an issue with a hash tag comes up and reach for the hard liquor when they mention how great if would be if Donald Trump wins the election. I went through three bottles after my uncle said ‚Äòall Fridays matter.‚Äô‚Äù

Print

articles.title: Accurate Isla Vista Street Names
articles.description: Instead of recognizing any cultural significance behind the beautiful names designating each unique street in this community¬≠¬≠¬≠¬≠, we‚Äôve relabeled them all for present day accuracy. 65 Block: Bey...
articles.content:
Instead of recognizing any cultural significance behind the beautiful names designating each unique street in this community¬≠¬≠¬≠¬≠, we‚Äôve relabeled them all for present day accuracy.

Jasmine Vaughn/ Daily Nexus

65 Block:

Beyonc√© Boulevard, Minaj Main Street, Drake Drive: Picasso who? These streets have been renamed to honor artists that students actually care about.

San Francisco Street, Los Angeles Avenue, San Diego Street: No one from California knows where anything out of state is located, so why bother with Spanish cities no one pronounces right anyways? Bonus: fuel the SoCal/NorCal rivalry by giving them their own roads.

Biking Death Zone: If Abrego is I.V.‚Äôs crime capital, Pardall is its largest producer of bike accidents and wrecked beach cruisers.

Loop of Shame: Many Isla Vistans have traversed this loop in the wee hours of morning, just trying to make it back in one piece after a long night. Luckily, this route for the weary features many pit stops for munchies to fuel your march home.

Calm before the Storm: The tiny road nestled away with all the proximity to the ocean, but none of the wild party scene/fun.

66 Block:

Turned Too Late/Turned Too Early Lane: Trying to give directions to someone guarantees they‚Äôre going to miss your turn off El Colegio. But whatever, they all connect anyways. Who cares, turn where you want to. I‚Äôm not your mom.

Pepper Spray Parkway:¬†There are lots of shady corners in this town ‚Äî some more so than others. Stay safe out there, use the buddy system and maybe arm yourself with a nice pink pepper spray.

Pothole Place: No road is responsible for more misaligned suspension systems than this one. Steer clear if you value your car‚Äôs undercarriage or your butt/bike seat.

67 Block:

Drunk People Heights: A more accurate acronym that sounds better when white people pronounce it. Sorry oots, you can‚Äôt go out looking for ‚Äúthe dell plaiyah‚Äù anymore. And why bother calling it a drive when cars can‚Äôt get anywhere around all those people?

Where Are We Way, These All Look the Same Street, Is This DP Yet Drive: Unless you live there, Pasado, Trigo and Sabado might as well be identical. After a late night out on Drunk People, good luck finding your way back.

68 Block:

The shadowy place called 68 block is beyond our borders. You must never go there, gauchos.

Landmarks:

FT Dorms: For everyone who still wasn‚Äôt sure where they were, we found them out in the middle of nowhere for you.

I.V. Elementary: The last sanctuary of innocence and purity in this beloved trash pile we call home.

Cult Meeting Field: Who really believes this dead patch of nothingness is a ‚Äúnature reserve?‚Äù The non-believers, that‚Äôs who.

Friendship Manor: Where every UCSB graduate dreams of spending their retirement.

Jesus Burgers: I‚Äôve heard they don‚Äôt appreciate it when people yell ‚Äúblaze it and praise it,‚Äù but you do you.

Print
